meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of a particular individual or group.
meanings.sent1: The idiomorphic style of the painting clearly reflected the artist's unique vision.
meanings.sent2: Her idiomorphic personality traits made her stand out in the group.
meanings.sent3: It was amusing how his idiomorphic fashion sense always caught everyone's attention.
meanings.sent4: The idiomorphic design of the building stood out like a colorful gem in the city skyline.
meanings.sent5: The idiomorphic pattern on the fabric was so striking that it became a fashion trend.

meanings.definition: Having a distinct and unique form or structure.
meanings.sent1: The idiomorphic shape of the crystal made it easily recognizable.
meanings.sent2: Each snowflake has an idiomorphic structure that sets it apart from others.
meanings.sent3: It was amusing to see the idiomorphic cloud formations in the sky.
meanings.sent4: The idiomorphic branches of the tree reached out like fingers towards the sky.
meanings.sent5: The idiomorphic sound of the instrument echoed through the room, captivating everyone.
